data.title: Russell Crowe back in Bangkok
data.description: Hollywood actor  Russell Crowe , who has endeared himself to Thais in recent years with his enthusiastic online posts about the country, is back in Bangkok.

data.title: What will Elon Musk get for his $130 million?
data.description: No billionaire did more to help Donald Trump win the US presidential election than Elon Musk. The Tesla and SpaceX boss will now find out whether it pays off or he ends up getting burned.

data.title: Trump win brings his criminal cases to a halt
data.description: WASHINGTON - Donald Trump’s US presidential election victory on Wednesday will essentially end the criminal cases brought against him — at least for the four years he occupies the White House.

data.title: Kittiratt off the hook for rice sale
data.description: The attorney-general has decided not to appeal the acquittal of former commerce minister Kittiratt Na-Ranong  in a malfeasance case linked to the sale of  rice  to Indonesia in 2011, according to an informed source.

data.title: Thai energy agency makes strong case for OCA development
data.description: The Energy Policy and Planning Office (EPPO) has suggested that the development of gas resources from the Overlapping Claims Area (OCA) could play a crucial role in stabilising Thailand's energy market.

data.title: Experts call on Thai govt to prioritise OCA negotiations with Cambodia
data.description: Energy experts have called on the Thai government to prioritise negotiations with Cambodia to settle the Overlapping Claims Area (OCA) in the Gulf of Thailand.

data.title: PM gives top priority to food security
data.description: Promoting Thailand’s  exports  and addressing  food security  concerns are among the major issues to be raised at two regional meetings in China, Prime Minister  Paetongtarn Shinawatra  said on Wednesday.

data.title: Record Loy Krathong spending won’t offset economic problems: UTCC
data.description: The University of the Thai Chamber of Commerce (UTCC) said that while spending during the Loy Krathong festival is expected to exceed 10 billion baht, it is unlikely to have a significant impact on the economy.

data.title: Iconic Italian ship docks in Phuket
data.description: PHUKET - Amerigo Vespucci, a tall ship of the Italian Navy named after the 16th century explorer, has arrived at Phuket Deep Sea Port and is welcoming visitors aboard to explore an exhibition of Italian art, culture and architecture.

data.title: Two alleged yakuza held for abduction, extortion
data.description: Two Japanese men accused of abducting a compatriot and extorting money from him before physically assaulting and forcing him to eat faeces have been arrested at a resort in Chon Buri.

data.title: Thai Airways union, creditors push back against proposed govt control
data.description: The Thai Airways labour union and the airline’s creditors have voiced strong opposition to a proposed amendment that seeks to add two government officials as its business rehabilitation plan administrators.

data.title: Donald Trump elected US president in stunning comeback
data.description: Donald Trump was elected president, capping a remarkable comeback four years after he was voted out of the White House and ushering in a new American leadership likely to test democratic institutions at home and relations abroad.

data.title: State railway sees ‘huge promise’ in 28 land plots
data.description: The  State Railway of Thailand  (SRT) is pinning its hopes on planned commercial  development  of 38,500 rai of land it owns, including 28 plots with “enormous” potential, to bring in 20 billion baht in revenue over the next four years.

data.title: Chadchart lauds US system for letting elected leaders complete their term
data.description: This is something Thailand can learn from, says Bangkok governor

data.title: Phuket Emerges as Global Luxury Lifestyle Hub for Investors
data.description: Phuket has undergone a remarkable transformation in recent years. Fringed by the Andaman Sea, this tropical oasis has evolved from a popular beach resort destination into one of the world’s most sought-after luxury residential markets, attracting elite consumer brands, Michelin-star dining, and international-standard education and medical care.

data.title: Maris issues clarification on maritime boundary talks with Cambodia
data.description: Any agreement must be approved by parliaments of both countries, he says

data.title: Bitkub Group Lights Up Thailand with Nationwide Billboard Spectacle!
data.description: Bitkub Capital Group Holdings is making waves again by launching billboard advertisements nationwide to celebrate and welcome developers, researchers, and blockchain technology enthusiasts from around the world attending the  7th Devcon conference. Titled "DEVCON Southeast Asia" and organised by the Ethereum Foundation, this annual gathering of Ethereum network developers takes place in Thailand from November 12-15, 2024, at Queen Sirikit National Convention Center in Bangkok.

data.title: Shopee, Lazada agree to remove illegal food products in 24 hours
data.description: The e-commerce platforms have agreed to comply with the Thai FDA to remove all unregistered food products and take swift action against violators within 24 hours

data.title: Skyview Bangkok Reopens Silver Lining Lounge for Exclusive Events
data.description: Skyview Hotel Bangkok proudly unveils the grand reopening of its newly renovated Silver Lining Lounge, an exclusive venue designed for high-end business and social events in Bangkok’s bustling city centre.

data.title: Shopee, Lazada agree to remove illegal food products in 24 hours
data.description: The e-commerce platforms have agreed to comply with the Thai FDA to remove all unregistered food products and take swift action against violators within 24 hours

data.title: ALive by AIA Launches ‘Be the Best Version’ Campaign
data.description: ALive Powered by AIA, the one-stop health and wellness application, has launched the “Be the Best Version of Yourself with ALive” campaign. This initiative aims to inspire individuals at every stage of life, bringing smiles and joy through activities that empower them to become better versions of themselves each day.

data.title: Police break up late-night brawl between Uzbekistani women in Pattaya
data.description: Pattaya broke up a violent turf war among freelance sex workers and later freed them without charges after both sides agreed to forgive each other
